Di DPR, PAN Ingatkan Fachrul Razi: Tapakkan Kaki di Bumi Jenderal
07 Nov 2019, 06:49 by Dewi Nurita, Purwanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Anggota Komisi VIII Ali Taher berceramah panjang lebar mengingatkan tugas Menteri Agama kepada Jenderal TNI Purnawirawan Fachrul Razi. Bekas Ketua Komisi VIII ini meminta Fachrul meninggalkan budaya militernya dan mulai beradaptasi sebagai Menteri Agama yang mengedepankan kedamaian.
"Saya berpesan kepada Bapak Menteri, jenderal tinggal jenderal, tapi jenderal yang tidak menapakkan kaki di bumi, kehilangan makna kejenderalannya," ujar pria asal Flores ini, saat rapat bersama Menteri Agama di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan pada Kamis, 7 November 2019.
"Saudara jangan pernah berbangga diri, tugas pemimpin adalah menggeser air mata kemiskinan menjadi air mata kebahagiaan," lanjut Ali.
Ali berharap, Zainut Tauhid sebagai Wakil Menteri Agama yang berasal dari NU juga mengingatkan bosnya jika kelewat batas dan masuk terlalu dalam ke ranah penafsiran agama. Hal ini disampaikan Ali menyangkut pernyataan-pernyataaan kontroversial yang belakangan dikeluarkan Fachrul terkait isu-isu radikalisme.
"Allah mempertemukan kedua orang ini, tentu ada maksud, yang satu radikal, ya menteri agama, yang satu kiai. Jenderal boleh merombak sesuatu, tetapi jangan lupa arah perombakan itu harus ihdinas siratal mustaqim," ujar Ali.
Ali lanjut bercerita kepemimpinan dua menteri berlatar belakang militer yang pernah menjabat di era orde baru. Mereka adalah Alamsyah Ratu Perwiranegara dan Tarmizi Taher. "Alamsyah jenderal yang melakukan perombakan, Tarmizi Taher jenderal yang sangat sufi. Sekarang, saya kepingin Menteri Agama yang jenderal tetapi juga sufi," ujar politikus senior PAN ini.
Terakhir, Ali Taher juga mengingatkan bahwa tugas Menteri Agama adalah menjadi wasit, untuk itu, tidak boleh masuk ke dalam permainan. "Jangan sampe wasit berjalan di dalam, lalu anda kehilangan pemain. Akhirnya, anda berjalan sendirian. Anda bisa ditinggalkan umat. Saya sayang pada anda, maka saya bicara apa adanya," ujar Ali Taher.

DEWI NURITA

In the DPR, PAN Reminds Fachrul Razi: Set foot on General's Earth
Nov 7 2019, 06:49 by Dewi Nurita, Purwanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Commission VIII member Ali Taher gave a lengthy lecture reminding the Minister of Religion's duty to Retired Army General Fachrul Razi. The former Chair of Commission VIII asked Fachrul to leave his military culture and begin to adapt as Minister of Religion promoting peace.
"I instructed the Minister, the general to remain a general, but the general who did not set foot on earth lost the meaning of his gender," said the man from Flores, during a meeting with the Minister of Religion at the Parliament Complex, Senayan on Thursday, November 7, 2019.
"You should never be proud of yourself, the leader's job is to shift tears of poverty into tears of happiness," Ali continued.
Ali hoped, Zainut Tauhid as Deputy Minister of Religion from NU also reminded his boss if it went too far and entered too deeply into the realm of religious interpretation. This was conveyed by Ali regarding the controversial statements that Fachrul later issued related to radicalism issues.
"Allah brought these two people together, of course there was a point, one radical, minister of religion, one kiai. The general may overhaul something, but don't forget the direction of the overhaul must be ihdinas siratal mustaqim," Ali said.
Ali further explained the leadership of two ministers with military backgrounds who had served in the New Order era. They are Alamsyah Ratu Perwiranegara and Tarmizi Taher. "Alamsyah is the general who made an overhaul, Tarmizi Taher is a very Sufi general. Now, I want the Minister of Religion who is a general but also Sufi," said the senior PAN politician.
Finally, Ali Taher also reminded that the duty of the Minister of Religion was to become a referee, for that reason, he could not enter the game. "Don't until the referee goes inside, then you lose the player. Finally, you walk alone. You can be left behind by the people. I love you, so I speak as it is," Ali Taher said.

DEWI NURITA
